body_html:
@ekelsen Hey, thanks for replying. If it's the intent that the seed is remembered in the graph operations and can't be altered after, the documentation could use some clarification.

In our use case, we are able to use the stateless_random_uniform from contrib and manually pass in the seed in the feed_dict, however this diminished the utility of a bunch of built-in operations like random_brightness, etc.
body_text:
@ekelsen Hey, thanks for replying. If it's the intent that the seed is remembered in the graph operations and can't be altered after, the documentation could use some clarification.
In our use case, we are able to use the stateless_random_uniform from contrib and manually pass in the seed in the feed_dict, however this diminished the utility of a bunch of built-in operations like random_brightness, etc.
body:
@ekelsen Hey, thanks for replying. If it's the intent that the seed is remembered in the graph operations and can't be altered after, the documentation could use some clarification.

In our use case, we are able to use the `stateless_random_uniform` from contrib and manually pass in the seed in the `feed_dict`, however this diminished the utility of a bunch of built-in operations like [random_brightness](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/image/random_brightness), etc.
